snippet: The I.M.F. does not use the term default. But missing the payment might lead to a situation in which other Greek debts are classified as defaults.
abstract: International Monetary Fund has placed Greece into 'arrears' following country's failure to make 1.5 billion euro payment, despite fact that much of world has described event as default; whatever the semantics, default is likely to roil financial markets, breed uncertainty and limit economic activity.
lead_paragraph: The I.M.F. does not use the term default. But missing the payment might lead to a situation in which other Greek debts are classified as defaults.

headline.main: Greece Is Placed in ‘Arrears,’ as the I.M.F. Spells ‘Default’
headline.print_headline: Athens Is Placed in ‘Arrears,’ as the I.M.F. Spells ‘Default’
